newsitem.title: USA: Calif. receives $30 mln grant for flood repairs.
newsitem.headline: Calif. receives $30 mln grant for flood repairs.

text.p: California Gov. Pete Wilson on Tuesday announced a new $30 million grant from the federal government to help the state repair damage caused by winter flooding.
Wilson said the funds would allow the state to continue repairing streets, parks, trails, school grounds, riverbanks and irrigation canals in northern and central California.
"The new grant means that we can continue repairing the damage and provide training and jobs for those with an immediate need," Wilson said in a statement.
The disaster recovery funds will be drawn from the Secretary of Labor's National Reserve Account.
Forty-four California counties were declared disasters in the wake of the January flooding.
